  "description": "HRGlobe Limited -&nbsp;Our client, a leading financial institution is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

	We are seeking a Personal Assistant (PA) to the Group Chief Finance Officer (GCFO) to provide high-level administrative, operational, and coordination support, enabling the effective execution of the GCFO&rsquo;s responsibilities.
	The role requires a highly intelligent, tech-savvy, proactive, and versatile individual who can think quickly, manage competing priorities, and operate with discretion in a fast-paced executive environment.


Job Duties


	Manage the GCFO&rsquo;s calendar, meetings, and appointments, ensuring optimal time management.
	Maintain accurate records, documents, and confidential files in both physical and digital formats.
	Follow up on action points and ensure timely execution of agreed outcomes.
	Strong powerpoint presentation skills, to assist in preparation of different executive presentations.
	Assist in financial reporting ad-hoc tasks. Have an interest in financial reporting and management reporting activities.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, logistics, and itineraries, ensuring efficiency and cost effectiveness.
	Use AI tools (e.g., generative AI, automation tools, scheduling assistants, document summarization tools) to enhance productivity and decision support.
	Assist with tracking expenses, approvals, and executive-level documentation.
	Handle multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.
	Manage sensitive information with discretion and sound judgment.
	Handle day-to-day administrative needs with speed and minimal supervision.
	Provide ad-hoc support on strategic or confidential assignments as required.


Job Requirements

	Excellent MS office tools (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) Power-Bi would be an added advantage.
	Exceptionally smart, fast-thinking, and able to process information quickly.
	Highly tech-savvy, with hands-on use of AI tools for writing, research, summarisation, scheduling, and productivity.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to communicate confidently and respectfully with senior stakeholders.
	Strong organisational and time-management skills.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and switch tasks quickly without loss of quality.

Personal Assistant to the Group Chief Finance Officer Job at HRGlobe Limited




        
    

        
        HRGlobe Limited - Our client, a leading financial institution is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant to the Group Chief Finance Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Personal Assistant (PA) to the Group Chief Finance Officer (GCFO) to provide high-level administrative, operational, and coordination support, enabling the effective execution of the GCFO’s responsibilities.
	The role requires a highly intelligent, tech-savvy, proactive, and versatile individual who can think quickly, manage competing priorities, and operate with discretion in a fast-paced executive environment.


Job Duties


	Manage the GCFO’s calendar, meetings, and appointments, ensuring optimal time management.
	Maintain accurate records, documents, and confidential files in both physical and digital formats.
	Follow up on action points and ensure timely execution of agreed outcomes.
	Strong powerpoint presentation skills, to assist in preparation of different executive presentations.
	Assist in financial reporting ad-hoc tasks. Have an interest in financial reporting and management reporting activities.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, logistics, and itineraries, ensuring efficiency and cost effectiveness.
	Use AI tools (e.g., generative AI, automation tools, scheduling assistants, document summarization tools) to enhance productivity and decision support.
	Assist with tracking expenses, approvals, and executive-level documentation.
	Handle multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining accuracy and attention to detail.
	Manage sensitive information with discretion and sound judgment.
	Handle day-to-day administrative needs with speed and minimal supervision.
	Provide ad-hoc support on strategic or confidential assignments as required.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent in Finance, Accounting, Economics or Management with 0-4 years of experience
	Prior experience as a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant is an advantage but not required
	Excellent MS office tools (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) Power-Bi would be an added advantage.
	Exceptionally smart, fast-thinking, and able to process information quickly.
	Highly tech-savvy, with hands-on use of AI tools for writing, research, summarisation, scheduling, and productivity.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to communicate confidently and respectfully with senior stakeholders.
	Strong organisational and time-management skills.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and switch tasks quickly without loss of quality.
